channel.title: Homes on Chuankai Zhao
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Chuankai Zhao

item.description: Biography I am currently a Ph.D. candidate in Chemical and Biomolecular Engineering at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign, advised by Professor Diwakar Shukla. Also, I am enrolled in the Graduate Concentration program in Computational Science and Engineering at Illinois. My Ph.D. research is mainly focused on combining statistics and machine learning to applications of molecular simulations in understanding complex biological and chemical processes, including protein-ligand binding, protein-DNA and protein-protein interactions, as well as polymer self-assembly.

item.title: Skills
item.description: Technical skills: Expertized in all atom and coarse grained molecular dynamics (MD), Monte Carlo simulations, biased sampling methods including metadynamics, umbrella sampling and replica-exchange MD. Expertized in stochastic modeling of time series data, particularly in Markov modeling of complex protein dynamics from large-scale MD simulations. Experienced in statistical free energy methods, including free energy perturbation, thermodynamic integration, weighted histogram analysis method (WHAM), multistate Bennett acceptance ratio (MBAR), and alchemical free energy calculations Experienced in high-performance computing, parallel programming and computing in multi-core CPU and GPU.

item.title: Coursework
item.description: Coursera Online Courses: * Bayesian Statistics (in progress) * Deep Learning Specialization (including Computer Vision and Natural Language Processing) * Machine Learning * Algorithms Specialization University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign: Applied Parallel Programming (CUDA Project: GPU Kernel for Forward Pass of Convolutional Neural Network) Scientific Visualization (Project: ‘WaterBank’ Webserver for Global Drought Visualization) Bioinformatics (Project: ‘MotifFinder’ Python program) Applied Mathematics Computational Chemical Biology Heat and Mass Transfer Statistical Thermodynamics Biomolecular Engineering Chemical Kinetics & Catalysis Shanghai Jiao Tong University (SJTU):
